p: Ginger is a rich source of bioactive compounds such as phenolic groups, alkaloids, and steroids, which have medicinal effect. The chief aromatic agent of the rhizome is the zingiberol with analogues such as the shogoals, paradol, and zingerone. In addition to the main bioactive compounds, ginger also contains other sub‐compounds such as 4‐gingerol, 6‐gingerol, 8‐gingerol, 10‐gingerols, 6‐shogaols, and 14‐shogaols (Ali, Blunde, Tanira, & Nemmar, 2008; US Report, 2013). They are reported to demonstrate antiemetic, antipyretic, analgesic, antiarthritic, and anti‐inflammatory activities.
